math.when_to_use: Use for calculus, algebra, and definitions; prefer primary/authoritative when high stakes.
math.when_not_to_use: Do not use for proofs or edge-case research under time pressure; trigger lookup_required if uncertain.

probability.when_to_use: Use for distributions, statistical definitions, and decision math; prefer NIST for reference definitions.
probability.when_not_to_use: Do not use to justify subjective priors; if consequences are high, require explicit lookup permission.

units.when_to_use: Use for unit conversions, SI definitions, and invariants.
units.when_not_to_use: Never invent conversions; if conversion is not already known with high confidence, request lookup to NIST/BIPM.

finance.when_to_use: Use for standard financial math definitions (PV, FV, IRR) and regulatory primary sources where applicable.
finance.when_not_to_use: Do not treat summaries as law; for compliance/legal stakes, prefer SEC primary sources.

systems.when_to_use: Use for time constants, growth models, and nonlinearity framing; prefer authoritative course materials.
systems.when_not_to_use: Do not rely on simplified heuristics when safety-critical; request lookup_required.

emergency.when_to_use: Use for high-pressure decision framing and stabilizing actions.
emergency.when_not_to_use: Do not provide medical or legal instructions; use frameworks only to guide safe next steps and request explicit lookup permission if needed.
